poem:
"Sky-Borne Bread"

Combing the skyline, birds of steel and mercy,
Unfurled wings are cradling manna, not missives.
In the dance of shadow and light over Gaza,
Each fall, not a fiery end, but a beginning.
In every packet, sting of salt, grain of hope,
Gently parachuting down like a peace dove's descent.
From high above, an endeavour - to turn
Warplanes into sparrows, bearing life in their beak.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Related: ‘I wish I had never come to the UK’: Palestinian academic despairs of getting visas for family stuck in Gaza US officials said that US and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
